alert.note: Alert for Garvin; Grady; McClain; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 2:20AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Garvin, southern Grady, Stephens and southwestern McClain Counties through 245 AM CST... At 220 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles west of Alex to 3 miles east of Marlow to near Comanche. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Duncan, Chickasha, Marlow, Lindsay, Goldsby, Comanche, Rush Springs, Bray, Dibble, Washington, Cole, Alex, Bradley, Agawam, Criner, Corum, northwestern Waurika Lake, Central High, Ninnekah and Empire City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 near mile marker 106. Interstate 44 between mile markers 73 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
